definition: to calm down/to quell one's anger
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: We shall have to stroke the old man down before we go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚出去之前得劝说那位老人息怒。

sentences.english: A soft answer turneth away wrath.
Good queen, let us entreat you.
sentences.chinese: 好女王，看在我的脸上，请息怒吧。

sentences.english: Elevator door has not yet pacified, but also with the sudden, to change the word gate.
sentences.chinese: 电梯门还没有息怒，又闹出了一起改字门。

sentences.english: They offered sacrifices to propitiate the god.
sentences.chinese: 他们供奉祭品以求神息怒。

sentences.english: Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.
sentences.chinese: 所以，求你息怒，回心转意，不要降祸给你的子民吧。

sentences.english: A soft answer turns away wrath.

definition: lit. to have eyes but fail to recognize Mt Tai (idiom)/fig. to fail to recognize sb important or sb's great talent/to be blind to the fact
pinyin: you3 yan3 bu4 shi2 Tai4 Shan1

definition: to report back to one's superior
to offer an apology/to make amends
keep calm, don't get excited/don't be impatient
a person of great moral stature does not remember the offenses committed by one of low moral stature
pinyin: da4 ren2 bu4 ji4 xiao3 ren2 guo4

definition: variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
One who does not know is not guilty/If one does not know any better, one cannot be held responsible
